intro: Cladocolea apiculata, commonly known as the mountain rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are clustered in small, rounded inflorescences. Cladocolea apiculata thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments.
